result.execSummary:
The defendant Darvon M Gibson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Trafficking of a Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.051(1).
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1703.00 payable to Kelly Johnson/Keystone Travel Services

COUNTS 1 & 2: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. All costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; All applicable fees of supervision. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: - No Contact with : J.B and A.N.S.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence; To be served in WSPS, with 288 days credit

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

Defendant Darvon M Gibson in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Darvon M Gibson in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
As to Count 1
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  12 YEARS with 288 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.
As to Count 2
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  9 MONTHS with 288 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 9 MONTHS

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: J.B and A.N.S
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:

Restitution in the amount of $1,703 Kelly Johnson/Keystone Travel Services 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied. 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

SAME APPEARANCES. 
Continued jury deliberations.  Jury questions placed on the record.   At the hour of 11:25 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY AS TO ALL BOTH COUNTS which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered victims names to be redacted from verdict forms.

SAME APPEARANCES. 
Continued jury deliberations.  Jury question placed on the record. Jurors released for the day at 4:53 pm to return at 8:30 am for deliberations.

Defendant Darvon M Gibson in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Darvon M Gibson in custody.  
Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for continuation of jury trial.  Jury requests to see exhibits.  The Court intends to exclude exhibits 2, 3, 4, and 8; no objection from the parties. Exhibits sent to jury room; deliberations resumed.  Court in recess.

SAME APPEARANCES.
Trial resumed at 2:08 pm. Sworn for defense: Darvon Gibson. Defense rests. Sidebars (2) placed on the record.   Court denies defense motion to dismiss. Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.   Jury retired at the hour of 4:26 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Johnson and Cmelak who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jurors released for the day at 4:41 pm to return at 8:30 am.

SAME APPEARANCES.
Trial resumed at 9:33 am. Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Keith Miller (continued testimony), MPD Officer Joan Mueller, MPD Officer Ivan Wick. State rests. Sworn for defense: Darvon Gibson.  Exhibits 1, 6-13, received.

SAME APPEARANCES.
Sworn for the state: Darrell S., J.B., Alicia L.(Sworn as interpreter: Fred Sevenson (Alex Wirth appeared)), MPD Officer Keith Miller.  Exhibit 2, received. Sidebar placed on the record.   Jurors released for the day at 4:24 pm to return at 8:30 am.

Defendant Darvon M Gibson in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Darvon M Gibson in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Trial resumed at 9:14 am.
Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Sworn for the state: Aleahya S and Jaime K. Exhibits 1-7 received. Defense requests witnesses be sequestered. Sidebars (2) placed on the record.  Parties released for lunch at 11:45 am to return at 1:30 pm. 



  Jury trial scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

SAME APPEARANCES. Defense does not oppose the state's motion for joinder. 
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:39 pm.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Jury released for the date at 4:13pm to return at 8:30 am.

Attorney Eric M. Hailstock in court, defendant Darvon M Gibson not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Darvon M Gibson in court with attorney Eric M. Hailstock.  Defendant Darvon M Gibson in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Keith Miller-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darvon M Gibson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Darvon M Gibson in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2 on behalf of the Defendant preserving Defendant's right of substitution.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
